issue.title: official binary releases should be shipped with debugging symbols
issue.body: currently the binaries (at least the linux binaries) are shipped without debugging symbols. that makes it harder to figure out where stuff goes wrong when debugging. released binaries should not be stripped.

events.body: Unstripped bitcoin is something like 100+megs, that seems like an excessive amount to ship.
well, maybe as a separate download, in addition to the stripped binaries.
I agree that they should be available as a separate download.  They should be available though.
gzipped bitcoin-qt with debugging symbols is about 14MB

Agreed on the condition that they're a separate download. This would make resolving published stack traces when people encounter problems much easier.
Gitian could produce separate archives of debug symbols using objcopy.

Doesn't seem necessary. Due to gitian being deterministic, it's possible to build the debug symbols when you need them (though it involves some patching -- would be nice to have a flag). I've successfully done this in at least one case to use addr2line on reported stack traces.
Closing this issue.
